reviews.review_msg: This is a worse course I have ever taken in my life. The TA sucks a lot. I don't prefer talking this course for elective since a LOT of memorization, well A LOT!!!!!!!! The midterm and final are hard af!

I just want to say I was very happy to take this course with Craig before he retired. He really is passionate about Kin and while other may find him boring by getting off topic with stories or articles that was the only reason i still came to class! Obviously being a Kin major I'm biased but this has been my favorite class to date.

Such a great prof.  Absolute no complaints here.  Final and midterm were so fair and so easy if you keep up.  Content was so interesting especially the last lectures about altitude physiology and underwater physiology.  I loved the stories he gave.  He had a great sense of humor and you could tell he really loves the subject.

In lecture Craig mostly read off of the slides, told a few stories about this adventures (awesome) and got off task a lot, but overall he was a great Prof. The content was not too much, you just have to put in the work to get the grade you want, the Labs we're so much fun, and the exams were not too difficult. i would recommend this class!!

although he's a very nice guy who likes to crack a few jokes during lecture, his class is pretty boring overall. he literally reads off the notes and barely adds anything to it so there really is no point in going to class. the midterms and final are straight off lecture notes and lab manual so just memorize everything on there and you're good

After the midterms and the finals, I feel that going to class isn't really that necessary, though it does help with retaining some information. His exams are straight forward with no trick questions, but there may be questions that will make you think a little bit and apply your understanding of the course material. Overall I would recommend him

Craigs lectures are a huge waste of time. He reads directly off notes, and he brings up irrelevant stories each class. Attendance is definitely not mandatory; I skipped 80% of the lectures and still got 98% on the midterm easily. Labs are helpful though.

Amazing prof!! He's super fair and lets you know exactly what is expected of you.  You won't go into an exam unsure of what is on it.  Labs are super helpful and if you study and learn all the material, this class is a good gpa booster.

Pretty great prof. Lectures aren't bad-depends on what you're learning. Some lectures he makes interesting & others are a bore. He's good when it comes to outlining criteria. You know exactly what he expects of you. Going to the lab is more important than the lecture. Not a difficult course, but don't slack off either.  Exams are fair so study.

Awesome professor! Tells you exactly what he expects on exams. Eg. Lecture exams are straight out of lecture notes... same thing with labs. Everything you need to know to do well is in the notes which is great because there are NO surprises on the test.

Don't take any classes with Craig if you can avoid it. He just goes off on tangents and doesn't address any course content and then puts it all on the exam. The class is easy but it's turned me off taking any BPK courses in the future
Nice guy, bad prof. Doesn't lecture about the actual course content at all, so don't bother coming to lecture. Trust me, you won't miss anything.

This class is hard. I got a C+. Class is not mandatory and labs are. You have weekly assignments and study questions for each week. The exams in lecture come from all the notes (lots of notes) so you have t do a lot of memorizing of some difficult concepts.

Amazing prof. Lectures were not mandatory but I still went to every one as he made them so interesting. Even though he does go off on a tangent often, his lectures still help with understanding of notes. Lots of memorization for midterm/final. Labs are fun and  easy. Lab MT and final are straight from practice q's.

He likes to tell a lot of stories (canoeing and football especially). Exams are straight from lecture notes and lectures are recorded. Lab exams are all from study questions. Marks are distributed well. He is a good prof, knowledgeable and willing to help. Definitely take a class with Craig.

Such an awesome prof! Likes to tell stories in class, and the content covered is pretty straight forward. Exams are based straight off lecture notes but know your stuff well since they're mostly theoretical questions. Anatomy exam for labs was difficult but do-able. I would take a course with Craig again :)

Craig knows what he's talking about, and everything he chooses to mention in class is explained well; the lectures, however, contain a small percent of what you need to know to succeed in the course.  Study the notes!  The Lab component can be a fair amount of work on a given week and the Anatomy exam is tacked onto the course without focus.

Craig's a good prof. His lectures are useless because he pretty much repeats the lecture notes and plus, they're recorded. He tells some pretty funny stories in lecture though. Labs can be fun too. Try to get Brent Flodin as your TA! He's super laid back and he's knowledgeable on the material and what's probably gonna be on the exams.

Really great professor. You can tell he's passionate about what he teaches. Exams are straight from his lecture notes and the study questions that he gives you. DON'T underestimate the course load though. Study, study study

He's so fun and nice! sometimes he gets off topic but seriously this is my fave class! the lec midterm was all from his notes and the lab midterm is all from the lab manual, i heard the questions are similar to study questions.

Lectures are really useless, but entertaining. He posts all notes online, in as much detail as you need to know for exams. Labs are very important, look at and learn all the info for study questions of each unit in your lab session, exam questions are pretty much straight from that.

Lecture exams are straight out of the notes and are predictable.The lab exams are EXACTLY like the study questions in the lab manual so make sure to find the answers to them as they're not all in the manual.He talks about unrelated stuff A LOT some enjoy it some find it a waste of time.Attendance is not mandatory

You don't really have to attend his lectures as he mostly just talks about random things, but he will tell what will be on his exams so that's a plus. Exams are straight from the textbook and is pretty simple if you memorize everything. Lab portion is fun and easy as long as you know what you're doing. Great GPA booster course and intro to Kin

Great prof! Very funny and engaging during lectures...actually makes you wanna go. He does get a bit off topic talking about his vacations and family or the SFU football team, but that gives your brain a break for 5 minutes which is nice. All the lectures are posted online which helps a lot as well. Helpful during office hours as well.
Really good prof, lectures not mandatory due to all notes being online. I recommend this prof, very engaging
Clearly knows what he is talking about, and isn't going to pretend otherwise. Entertaining and interesting.

Highly recmmended. One of the greastest profs at Sfu, his knowledge is very high in the material he teaches and always makes his lectures intersting with funny stories which give you a reason to go to the class. I found it more helpful to go to the class because material makes alot more sense with all the examples he provides.
Awesome professor. Loved his class. Just one of those classes where you're more interested in learning the material rather than simply getting the grade.
So funny, and his pictures make lectures interesting
He's a treat! His stories will make your life so much better.. Very interesting class:)

This is a very straight-forward class. The only thing that makes it difficult the amount of information you have to remember, but it is all right from his notes. His classes are interesting and he tells good stories to accompany the topics we are learning. A really amazing prof and course.
Asmundson is the best prof ever. hes a pretty cule guy.

Craig is a great guy. He is a good teacher, who is very approachable. He tells some pretty good stories during class too. Also, his exams com purely from his notes, which are online. I stopped taking notes in class, I just listened. The only negative thing about the lectures is that the tend to drag on. My class felt much longer than the 50 minutes
Craig is an excellent teacher.  He's pretty funny, makes lectures interesting.  The only complaint I would have is how much memorization you have to do in this class.
a legend
